title.narrative: SANITATION AND HYGIENE PRACTICES

description.narrative: Vulnerable and emergency-affected people have access to basic sanitation facilities, which contributes to Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Vulnerable and emergency-affected people have access to basic sanitation facilities

description.narrative: During the year, UNICEF continued to promote ending open defecation by 2030 in South Sudan. UNICEF supported the development of National CLTS guidelines for South Sudan to enhance government commitment to the sanitation road map, leveraging investment through coherent public communications and limited-cost mobilization. ;As a result, 59 per cent of the targeted population gained access to safe sanitation in 87 villages in Northern Behr El Ghazal and Eastern Equatoria States (65% of the annual target) which were declared open defecation free.; | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:11/01/2022
